subject: AI & Agents
title: Vector Search: Meaning over Keywords
description: Learn Vector Search: Meaning over Keywords in one minute.

hook.text: Search 'how to fix a broken heart' in a medical database. Vector search finds cardiology articles.

buildup.text: Vector search encodes queries and documents as embeddings, then finds nearest neighbors.

discovery.text: Vector databases (Pinecone, Weaviate, pgvector) store and index millions of embeddings.

twist.text: Embedding models can be biased‚Äî'nurse' might be closer to 'woman' than to 'man.'

climax.text: For production: use approximate nearest neighbor (ANN) algorithms like HNSW for speed.

punchline.text: Search by meaning, not by matching characters.

quiz.question: What algorithm do vector databases use for fast retrieval?
